TopicTitle: 1.1 graphics: Turn back on all the stuff you turned off.

Articles.Content:
I’ve read a lot of people are not seeing improvement in graphics in 1.1. 

Maybe, like me, you have turned much of your graphics settings off. I was running with medium rez textures, minimum shadows, and no antialiasing.

Now I’m at full rez textures, AA set to 4x, and I’ve maxed out the shadow settings (which makes the shadow artifacts go away)

And boooy is this game prettier AND I STILL have a much faster framerate. 

Edited April 26, 2016 by Brainlord Mesomorph

My PC was powerful enough to run KSP at max settings long before 1.1. and It still looks better to me. seems Unity 5 as better default Ambient occlusion the Unity 4.I don't know for sure but the game overall just looks better then 1.0.

Started playing KSP 1.1 in my Mac.

I died inside for every setting i had to lower until it was finally at the same settings as 1.0.5. 

It wasn't as prominent as it was on my Windows computer.
I'm on an Intel 4000 with an i7; performance is about the same with SM3 terrain shaders.  If I turn them off in the settings file (since SM2 shaders are now deprecated >_>) the game runs very well.
ive noticed the odd VAB gfx too.  not only the parts list, but the actual craft i'm building all the parts look pastel-ish colored

I'm running Scatterer and PlanetShine but even under that I noticed the ambient light seems to have been improved. Well, 'improved' is an odd thing for me to say, since now PS can't brighten the dark sides of planets for me; I have a slight phobia of them and hate getting a night-time re-entry. Oh well. Also worth mentioning is the new water; it seems both softer and safer to land on as well as nicer looking, and things bob up and down on the surface. If you land in the ocean with no land it sight it feels like the waves are taking you somewhere, even though the velocity readout is 0.0m/s.

 

1 hour ago, WildLynx said:

For me, KSP started to look worse, at least in the VAB. Parts in the list are grey-ish, and attachment nodes are of some dark-dead-green-glass color, instead of lively green they used to be.

[Linux Mageia 5 x64, GTX 550 Ti]

35 minutes ago, TK421d said:

ive noticed the odd VAB gfx too.  not only the parts list, but the actual craft i'm building all the parts look pastel-ish colored

I think the assembly building parts are set to 'fullbright' (no light source, parts are same brightness all over and don't shine etc.) intentionally for the utilitarian purpose of always being able to perfectly see exactly what you're building. I agree however that it's more odd looking than really helpful.

Edited April 26, 2016 by Guest

23 minutes ago, String Witch said:

I'm running Scatterer and PlanetShine but even under that I noticed the ambient light seems to have been improved

I agree with this in general

However, IVA view reveals some very strange shadow issues, light seems to enter through the sides of the pod.

1 minute ago, Violent Jeb said:

I agree with this in general

However, IVA view reveals some very strange shadow issues, light seems to enter through the sides of the pod.

Disabling Scatterer's god rays might fix that.
I will check it out, thanks! I also haven't really tried turning everything up to max. My PC should be able to handle it.. i'm just used to the ways of <1.0.5
I appear to be having some graphics card related issues with x64 so once that gets sorted out, I will install MOAR VISUALS!! Seriously though, the graphics issues are annoying.
Well my graphics suck so nope. Any higher than Fastest and everything catches fire.

Aside from itsy-bitsy, teeny-weeny fonts on my 4K monitor (and sadness that the UI scale setting didn't help that), the game looks really good and runs like gangbusters, nice and smooth for once. Nice to have anti-aliasing back after having to run the game in OpenGL mode.

Edited April 26, 2016 by JonathanPerregaux
